channel.title: The Moth Podcast
channel.description: Since its launch in 1997, The Moth has presented thousands of true stories, told live and without notes, to standing-room-only crowds worldwide. Moth storytellers stand alone, under a spotlight, with only a microphone and a roomful of strangers. The storyteller and the audience embark on a high-wire act of shared experience which is both terrifying and exhilarating. Since 2008, The Moth podcast has featured many of our favorite stories told live on Moth stages around the country. For information on all of our programs and live events, visit themoth.org.

item.title: Jon Ronson & Micah Truran
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: Stories about Identity: Jon battles a Twitterbot that is using his name and his photo, and Micah’s lucky red tie leads to a revealing encounter with his musical hero.
item.content:encoded: Stories about Identity: Jon battles a Twitterbot that is using his name and his photo, and Micah’s lucky red tie leads to a revealing encounter with his musical hero.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories about Identity: Jon battles a Twitterbot that is using his name and his photo, and Micah's lucky red tie leads to a revealing encounter with his musical hero.

item.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Hand Transplant, DNA, and a Backwards Heart
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: An astrophysicist discovers wild parallels in her research and romantic life, a surgeon details his involvement in one of the world’s first-ever hand transplants, and a geneticist is called to testify in a murder case and lays the groundwork for DNA fingerprinting as forensic evidence. Storytellers: Janna Levin, Kodi Azari, and Eric S. Lander
item.content:encoded:
An astrophysicist discovers wild parallels in her research and romantic life, a surgeon details his involvement in one of the world’s first-ever hand transplants, and a geneticist is called to testify in a murder case and lays the groundwork for DNA fingerprinting as forensic evidence.

Storytellers: Janna Levin, Kodi Azari, and Eric S. Lander
item.itunes:subtitle: An astrophysicist discovers wild parallels in her research and romantic life, a surgeon details his involvement in one of the world's first-ever hand transplants, and a geneticist is called to testify in a murder case and lays the groundwork for DNA fi...
item.itunes:summary:
An astrophysicist discovers wild parallels in her research and romantic life, a surgeon details his involvement in one of the world's first-ever hand transplants, and a geneticist is called to testify in a murder case and lays the groundwork for DNA fingerprinting as forensic evidence.
Storytellers: Janna Levin, Kodi Azari, and Eric S. Lander
item.itunes:author: The Moth

item.title: Kimya Dawson & Kevin Haas: Halloween Stories
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: It’s The Moth Podcast Halloween Special! A young woman working at a haunted maze encounters a pop star and workers at a bar are confronted by a band of roving vampires. Storytellers: Kimya Dawson and Kevin Haas. Music in this episode by The Uncluded.
item.content:encoded:
It’s The Moth Podcast Halloween Special! A young woman working at a haunted maze encounters a pop star and workers at a bar are confronted by a band of roving vampires.

Storytellers: Kimya Dawson and Kevin Haas.

Music in this episode by The Uncluded.

item.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Red Sox, Jerusalem, and Coming Home
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: A father bonds with his son over baseball, a boy realizes that his single father is not a superhero, a worker at a community center has a knife pulled on her, a newly divorced mother is evicted from her home, and a young writer moves to Jerusalem with the hope that peace will break out. Storytellers: Jimmy […]
item.content:encoded:
A father bonds with his son over baseball, a boy realizes that his single father is not a superhero, a worker at a community center has a knife pulled on her, a newly divorced mother is evicted from her home, and a young writer moves to Jerusalem with the hope that peace will break out.

Storytellers: Jimmy Tingle, Jason Schmidt, Launa Lea, Gretchen Waschke, and Nathan Englander.

item.title: The Moth Radio Hour: Live from Boston
item.dc:creator: Whitney Jones
item.description: A special live edition of The Moth recorded at the Shubert Theatre in Boston. A New York City cop looks into the death of a kid he grew up with, a jazz musician dreams of playing with James Brown, and a woman falls in love over the protestations of her family. Storytellers: Steve Osborne, Christian McBride, and Mary […]
item.content:encoded:
A special live edition of The Moth recorded at the Shubert Theatre in Boston. A New York City cop looks into the death of a kid he grew up with, a jazz musician dreams of playing with James Brown, and a woman falls in love over the protestations of her family.

Storytellers: Steve Osborne, Christian McBride, and Mary Lou Piland
